intro: Descurainia sophia subsp. bartschii, commonly known as the Bartsch's Tansy Mustard, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and segmented leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, harsh environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as steppes and mountain slopes.
